ratings.question_text: Your level of engagement with the course was:
What is your overall assessment of this course?
The course was well organized to facilitate student learning.
I received clear feedback that improved my learning.
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the level of intellectual challenge of this course was:
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the workload of this course was:

narratives.question_text: What knowledge, skills, and insights did you develop by taking this course?
comments: Learning about Indonesian language and culture

Basic communication (writing, listening, and speaking) of Indonesian. Cultural insights from a two professors on Indonesian life and importance. A greater view of the world that is not as Eurocentric.
Basic level of Indonesian and knowledge of Indonesia culture

Along with learning the basics of the Indonesian language, I learned about the astounding cultural advancements in the country itself. Pak Indriyo did a great job of teaching me many things about Indonesia, not just the language. I learned how to play the Angklun, a musical instrument in Indonesian culture. I ate an Indonesian fruit. I spoke with various teachers from Indonesia. Overall this class was highly enjoyable and educational.
Developed a basic grasp of Indonesian grammar and acquired a simple vocabulary

I learned a new language which allowed me to obtain knowledge on a new region of the world along with its wonderful culture. Language classes demonstrate the importance of reviewing your material as much as possible after it has been taught to you, so that it is easier to go about future events in the course. It is important to try new things because you may develop a love for them.
I learned a lot about the culture of Indonesia and how to speak the language. I feel confident in my ability to go to Indonesia and speak to people.
I learned how to speak and write in Indonesian. I also learned a lot about the culture!
I learned, not only about the Indonesian language, but also the culture of the people of Indonesia. Pak Indriyo and Kak Nia provided a great deal of information about the culture of the people.

narratives.question_text: What are the strengths and weaknesses of this course and how could it be improved?
comments:
Strength: lots of fun
Weakness: unorganized and grading was confusing when you couldnt tell how big of an impact assignments would have on your grade/never knew about assignments more than a week in advance
I think this course was very well structured and easy to follow along. One way I think it could be improved is if deadlines for assignments were put on canvas when talked about in class.
Was fun and engaging, which isn't often the case with language classes for me

This course was highly interactive, and Ive spent many days interacting with my peers and Pak Indriyo outside of class also. I was able to learn through my peers. I did struggle from time to time with the organization of the class.  At times, it was a bit disorganized and hard to predict. I think it would be good to develop a better timeline for learning the beginning vocabulary, and maybe implement vocab tests or something to ensure that students learn the new vocab and are familiar with it.

Pak Indriyo made great efforts to provide an engaging and interesting class experience, and was genuinely invested in the learning of his students. Kak Nia provided timely and constructive feedback on assignments.

However, the course would have benefited from slightly more structure (e.g. flagging of key assessment dates at the start of term) and a more ambitious pace, particularly at the start of term

The teacher tries to keep the students engaged by doing different activities, so that each class is a bit different. The teacher is awesome, but sometimes it can be hard to communicate outside the classroom with technology

Strengths: Professor and TA are very good and run the curriculum well. They also know the regions well and can give us interesting information relating to the material.
No weaknesses
Pak Indriyo and Kak Nia were absolutely amazing and they really cared about every student. I loved how interactive the class was and I really liked the ngobrols each week.
Strengths: student engagement

narratives.question_text: Would you recommend this course to another student? Please explain.
comments: I would highly recommend this course to another student.  It's fun, I learned a ton, and the workload and my stress associated with the class were both very low.  Pak Indriyo and Kak Nia were both great.
Yes! Indonesian is such an enriching language to learn and I hope to travel there someday.
Yes, far better then other language courses
I would highly recommend this course to another student. I enjoyed this course because Pak Indriyo is a great instructor and he made the class fun.
Yes - overall, the course was well taught and enjoyable
Yes I would highly recommend this class. I genuinely enjoy going to this class every day. The teacher is amazing and wants his students to do well.
Yes, it is a great language and it is really interesting learning about the culture.
Yes! 100%! I learned so much and I had a lot of fun taking this course.
Yes, Pak Indriyo and Kak Nia provided an amazing learning environment for all students, as well as forming amazing relationships with each student
